cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles south of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across Cuba tonight and Monday, then turning northwest and entering the Gulf of Mexico Tuesday; forecast to aim toward the upper Texas–south-west Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-west Louisiana coast near the Lake Charles/Cameron area

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet – watches currently confined to the Caribbean and Florida Keys
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued yet – warnings currently confined to Hispaniola, Cuba and the southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast to south-west Louisiana expected to receive the core of the storm
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds are likely with a 57% chance; hurricane-force winds (64-kt) reach 12% probability, so damaging gusts are possible in the port area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Model guidance for a strengthening hurricane making landfall just west of the Calcasieu Ship Channel supports a storm-surge potential well above 3 ft, possibly 5–7 ft in and around Lake Charles.
weather_observation.rainfall: Projected 4–8 inches of rain with isolated higher totals could cause fresh-water flooding and drainage issues at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands and extended port closures due to approach/evacuation of vessels are possible.
